N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 701.6 - Class a fresh surface waters

State Regulations
(a) The
best usages of Class A waters are: a source of water supply for drinking, culinary or food processing purposes; primary and secondary contact recreation; and fishing. The waters shall be suitable for fish, shellfish and wildlife
propagation and survival. (b) This
classification may be given to those waters that, if subjected to approved
treatment equal to coagulation, sedimentation, filtration and disinfection, with additional treatment if necessary to reduce naturally present impurities, meet or will meet New York State Department of Health drinking water standards
and are or will be considered safe and satisfactory for drinking water
purposes. Notes
